title: Native American and Other Ancient Remedies
description: Native Americans have been practicing medicine for thousands of years and many of their herbal remedies are still used today.
cleaned_text: For thousands of years, [Native Americans](https://www.legendsofamerica.com/native-americans/) have used [herbs](https://www.legendsofamerica.com/na-herbs/) to heal the body, purify the spirit, and bring balance into their lives and surroundings. Oral traditions indicate that they learned about the healing powers of herbs and other plants by watching sick animals. There are no written records of herbal use by the indigenous people of America before the first contact between Europeans and the [tribes](https://www.legendsofamerica.com/na-tribelist/). However, this changed as Native Americans shared their knowledge of how to use nature's medicines with the new settlers. While hundreds of herbs and plants were used in [Native American remedies](https://www.legendsofamerica.com/na-medicine/), one of the most sacred was [tobacco](https://www.legendsofamerica.com/na-herbs/9#Tobacco), which was used to heal numerous conditions, rituals, and ceremonies. It was smoked pure and not mixed with any chemicals as it is today. Another essential herb to the Native Americans was [Sage](https://www.legendsofamerica.com/na-herbs/8/#Sage), which was said to not only heal multiple problems of the [stomach](https://www.legendsofamerica.com/na-remedy8.html#Stomach Problems:), [colon](https://www.legendsofamerica.com/na-remedy/3/#Colon Problems), [kidneys](https://www.legendsofamerica.com/na-remedy/7/#Kidney Function and Problems, including Kidney Stones), [liver](https://www.legendsofamerica.com/na-remedy/7/#Liver Problems, Disease and Health), [lungs](https://www.legendsofamerica.com/na-remedy/8/#Respiratory Problems), [skin](https://www.legendsofamerica.com/na-remedy8.html#Skin Disorders:), and more, but it was also believed to protect against harmful spirits and to draw them out of the body or the soul. Though the list of medicinal [herbs](https://www.legendsofamerica.com/na-herbs/) that might be carried in a [Healer's ](https://www.legendsofamerica.com/na-medicine/#Healers)medicine bundle are many and varied, those that were most often used were frequently carried, such as remedies for common [colds](https://www.legendsofamerica.com/na-remedy/3/#Colds), which might include [American Ginseng ](https://www.legendsofamerica.com/na-herbs/#American Ginseng)or including [Feverwort](https://www.legendsofamerica.com/na-herbs/4/#Feverwort), and [Willow Bark](https://www.legendsofamerica.com/na-herbs/9/#Willow). This list includes many [herbs](https://www.legendsofamerica.com/na-herbs/) used by Native Americans and others that have been beneficial for various ailments throughout history. It also contains [herbs](https://www.legendsofamerica.com/na-herbs/) used for many of today's ailments. Please note that some [herbs](https://www.legendsofamerica.com/na-herbs/) used in history are no longer recommended today.
